name: Kishin D?ji ZENKI: Battle Raiden
description:
Once already Chiaki and her reluctant demon servant Zenki have saved the world from the forces of darkness, but apparently once is never enough. Chiaki has a vision of five cloaked figures and knows that only she and Zenki can stop them. At once they set off to track down the demon leaders.

In Kishin Douji ZENKI: Battle Raiden the player takes the role of Zenki. At first, and occasionally through the game, Zenki will be in his powered down form where he can only punch, jump, and dash. After Chiaki recovers her bracelet, or regains her concentration, or whatever she needs to do at the time, she can transform Zenki into his powered up form. In this form Zenki deals more damage and has a much longer list of attacks that get added to as the game progresses, such as a pillar of energy, an electrified punch, and a dashing attack. By picking up scrolls Zenki can do a powerful Rudora attack to all enemies on screen, but this attack damages Zenki as well.

To complete platforming levels Zenki will have to make it to the end of the level while occasionally finding hidden stone monuments that, when destroyed, will drop items as well as alter the level or remove obstacles, allowing Zenki to pass. After a stage's first platforming level is a midboss fight, and after the second platforming level is the boss fight proper.

shot.caption: Title Screen
Forty years of darkness! Earthquakes, volcanoes, human sacrifice...
...cats and dog, living together! Mass hysteria!
Starting Stage 1
Chiaki what have I told you about talking with strange birds in dark forests?
Powered down Zenki might be small, but most enemy attacks go right over his head.
These rocks hold all sorts of goodies, and usually have to be destroyed to continue on in a level anyways.
Death cutscene
Giant boulder in a cave? Nothing strange about that.
Giant boulder with legs and a head that drops rocks on your head? That's a little strange.
Lost magic bracelets are always in the last place you look.
It's morphin' time!
Collect three scrolls and you get one charge of Zenki's devistating Rudora attack.
Powered up Zenki has a laundry list of totally sweet powers, like tossing balls of electricity.
Zenki runs into much more dangerous enemies while powered up.
Sometimes, instead of finding life-giving demon-eyes in stones, you'll find demon demon-eyes that grow legs and try to eat you.
Pre-fight chat with the demons' leader.
Zenki's energy pillar attack is the best attack to knock down the boss while he's floating around.
Midway through the fight he ditches the gown and starts flinging projectiles.
Cleared
I hate the undead.
Thankfully a Rudora will take care of them.
Oh Kokutei, what have they done to you?
Stage 2's midboss floats about, summoning ghouls and ghosts while ramming you.
It's not a terribly effective strategy against Zenki.
Chiaki loses her concentration, and this next set of platforming challenges will have to be attempted as powered down Zenki.
Oh, sorry, didn't realise this pool was taken already.
Nagi gets her Belmont on for the start of this fight.
Halfway through the fight she switches it up to full on Medusa-mode.
Zenki, who was getting bored anyways, decides to wrestle with a four armed bear.
These volcanic caves host all sorts of nasties.
They don't call Zenki the Dragon Slayer for nothing. Actually they don't call Zenki the Dragon Slayer, but they're about to.
